name: scrappiness
content:
scrappiness noun [U]
(BAD ORGANIZATION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
UK the quality of being badly organized or put together: The game quickly degenerated into scrappiness. The scrappiness of her lesson plans is a disgrace.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a scrappiness about how the story has been translated into drama.There was a scrappiness to the production, with rushed dances and uncertain performances.His editors mention the scrappiness of the author's material.

scrappiness noun [U]
(DETERMINATION)
US the quality of being strong and determined, and willing to argue or fight for what you want: He demonstrated the scrappiness that has made him such a successful entrepreneur. She needed every bit of her famous scrappiness to become a success.
More examplesFewer examplesOur scrappiness comes from our years of living in the street.These people have a certain scrappiness, a willingness to roll up their sleeves and get on with the work.
